abstract: Timothy Polin opens our solving week.
lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — Far be it from me to suggest that a constructor might create a puzzle that appeals directly to the crosswords editor Will Shortz for personal reasons, but sometimes I feel like a given puzzle might have been created to appeal directly to Mr. Shortz for personal reasons. That doesn’t mean that the puzzle isn’t enjoyable; it’s just a thing I’ve noticed. And for some reason, it never fails to make me smile.
